name: Groiners
description: Begin in a pushup position on the floor. This will be your starting position.

name: Axle Deadlift
description: Approach the bar so that it is centered over your feet. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, allowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typically, you would use an over/under grip.

name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
description: Using a close grip, lift the EZ bar and hold it with your elbows in as you lie on the bench. Your arms should be perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.

name: Cable Chest Press
description: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.

name: Cuban Press
description: From a seated or standing position, hold a dumbbell in each hand with your shoulders rotated forward. Your arms should be fully extended next to your thighs with only a slight bend at the elbows and with the palms of your hands facing your thighs.  This will be your starting position.

name: Dynamic Chest Stretch
description: Stand with your hands together, arms extended directly in front of you. This will be your starting position.

name: Full Range-Of-Motion Lat Pulldown
description: Either standing or seated on a high bench, grasp two stirrup cables that are attached to the high pulleys. Grab with the opposing hand so your arms are crisscrossed about you and your palms are facing forward.

name: IT Band and Glute Stretch
description: Loop a belt, rope, or band around one of your feet, and swing that leg across your body to the opposite side, keeping the leg extended as you lay on the ground. This will be your starting position.

name: Crunches
description: Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground, or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle. If you are resting your feet on a bench, place them three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.

name: Kneeling Squat
description: Set the bar to the proper height in a power rack. Kneel behind the bar; it may be beneficial to put a mat down to pad your knees. Slide under the bar, racking it across the back of your shoulders. Your shoulder blades should be retracted and the bar tight across your back. Unrack the weight.

name: Neck-SMR
description: Using a muscle roller or a rolling pin, place the roller behind your head and against your neck. Make sure that you do not place the roller directly against the spine, but turned slightly so that the roller is pressed against the muscles to either side of the spine. This will be your starting position.

name: Overhead Stretch
description: Standing straight up, lace your fingers together and open your palms to the ceiling. Keep your shoulders down as you extend your arms up.

name: Muscle Up
description: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Initiate a pull up by pulling the elbows down to your side, flexing the elbows.

name: Overhead Triceps
description: Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your elbow and wrist. This will be your starting position.

name: Jogging-Treadmill
description: To begin, step onto the treadmill and select the desired option from the menu. Most treadmills have a manual setting, or you can select a program to run. Typically, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.

name: Plate Twist
description: Lie down on the floor or an exercise mat with your legs fully extended and your upper body upright.  Grab the plate by its sides with both hands out in front of your abdominals with your arms slightly bent.

name: Quick Leap
description: You will need a box for this exerise.

name: Lying Triceps Press
description: Lie on a flat bench with either an e-z bar (my preference) or a straight bar placed on the floor behind your head and your feet on the floor.

name: Quadriceps-SMR
excerciseType: Foam Roll Quadriceps, Myofascial Release Quads
description: Lay facedown on the floor with your weight supported by your hands or forearms. Place a foam roll underneath one leg on the quadriceps, and keep the foot off of the ground. Make sure to relax the leg as much as possible. This will be your starting position.

name: Quad Stretch
description: Lay on your side. Loop a belt, rope, or band around your top foot. Flex the knee and extend your hip, attempting to touch your glutes with your foot, and holding the belt with your hands. This will be your starting position.

name: Lying Supine Dumbbell Curl
description: Lie down on a flat bench face up while holding a dumbbell in each arm on top of your thighs.

name: Lying T-Bar Row
description: Load up the T-bar Row Machine with the desired weight and adjust the leg height so that your upper chest is at the top of the pad.

name: Lying One-Arm Lateral Raise
description: While holding a dumbbell in one hand, lay with your chest down on a flat bench.  The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.

name: Lying Prone Quadriceps
description: Lay face down on the floor with your partner kneeling beside you. Flex one knee and raise that leg off the ground, attempting to touch your glutes with your foot. Your partner should hold the knee and ankle. This will be your starting position.

name: Lying Rear Delt Raise
description: While holding a dumbbell in each hand, lay with your chest down on a flat bench.

name: Lying Machine Squat
description: Adjust the leg machine to a height that will allow you to get inside it with your knees bent and the thighs slightly below parallel.

name: Lying Leg Curls
description: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie face down on the leg curl machine with the pad of the lever on the back of your legs (just a few inches under the calves).

name: Lying Hamstring
description: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Your partner should be kneeling beside you. Raise one leg up towards the ceiling and have your partner hold the ankle. Your partner can use their shoulder to brace your leg if necessary. This will be your starting position.

name: Lying High Bench Barbell Curl
description: Lie face forward on a tall flat bench while holding a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing up).

name: Lying Glute
description: Lie on your back with your partner kneeling beside you.

name: Lying Face Up Plate Neck Resistance
description: Lie face up with your whole body straight on a flat bench while holding a weight plate on top of your forehead.

name: Lying Crossover
description: Lie on your back with your legs extended.

name: Lying Dumbbell Tricep Extension
description: Lie on a flat bench while holding two dumbbells directly in front of you. Your arms should be fully extended at a 90-degree angle from your torso and the floor.  The palms should be facing in and the elbows should be tucked in.  This is the starting position.

name: Lying Face Down Plate Neck Resistance
description: Lie face down with your whole body straight on a flat bench while holding a weight plate behind your head.

name: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Press To Chin
description: While holding a barbell or EZ Curl bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward), lie on your back on a flat bench with your head off the end of the bench.

name: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Extension Behind The Head
description: While holding a barbell or EZ Curl bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward), lie on your back on a flat bench with your head close to the end of the bench.

name: Lying Cambered Barbell Row
description: Place a cambered bar underneath an exercise bench.

name: Lying Close-Grip Bar Curl On High Pulley
description: Place a flat bench in front of a high pulley or lat pulldown machine.

name: Lying Cable Curl
description: Grab a straight bar or E-Z bar attachment that is attached to the low pulley with both hands, using an underhand (palms facing up) shoulder-width grip.

name: Lying Bent Leg Groin
description: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the soles of the feet pressed together. Have your partner hold your knees. This will be your starting position.

name: Lunge Sprint
description: Adjust a bar in a Smith machine to an appropriate height. Position yourself under the bar, racking it across the back of your shoulders. Unrack the bar, and then split your feet, moving one foot forward and one foot back. This will be your starting position.

name: Lunge Pass Through
description: Stand with your torso upright holding a kettlebell in your right hand. This will be your starting position.

name: Lower Back-SMR
excerciseType: Foam Roll Erector Spinae, Lower Back Myofascial Release
description: In a seated position, place a foam roll under your lower back. Cross your arms in front of you and protract your shoulders. This will be your starting position.

name: Lower Back Curl
description: Lie on your stomach with your arms out to your sides. This will be your starting position.

name: Low Cable Triceps Extension
description: Select the desired weight and lay down face up on the bench of a seated row machine that has a rope attached to it. Your head should be pointing towards the attachment.

name: Low Pulley Row To Neck
description: Sit on a low pulley row machine with a rope attachment.

name: London Bridges
description: Attach a climbing rope to a high beam or cross member. Below it, ensure that the smith machine bar is locked in place with the safeties and cannot move. Alternatively, a secure box could also be utilized.

name: Low Cable Crossover
description: To move into the starting position, place the pulleys at the low position, select the resistance to be used and grasp a handle in each hand.

name: Looking At Ceiling
description: Kneel on the floor, holding your heels with both hands.

name: Log Lift
description: Begin standing with the log in front of you. Grasp the handles, and begin to clean the log. As you are bent over to start the clean, attempt to get the log as high as possible, pulling it into your chest. Extend through the hips and knees to bring it up to complete the clean.

name: Linear Depth Jump
description: You will need two boxes or benches spaced a few feet away from each other. Begin by standing on one box facing towards the other platform.

name: Linear Acceleration Wall Drill
description: Lean at around 45 degrees against a wall. Your feet should be together, glutes contracted.

name: Linear 3-Part Start Technique
description: This drill helps you accelerate as quickly as possible into a sprint from a dead stop. It helps to use a line to start from. Begin with two feet on the line. Place your left foot with the toe next to your right ankle. Place your right foot 4-6 inches behind the left.

name: Leverage Shrug
description: Load the pins to an appropriate weight. Position yourself directly between the handles.

name: Leverage Shoulder Press
description: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the top  of the shoulders at the beginning of the motion. Your chest and head should be up and handles held with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position.

name: Leverage Iso Row
description: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level.  Grasp the handles with either a neutral or pronated grip. This will be your starting position.

name: Leverage Incline Chest Press
description: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the top  of the pectorals at the beginning of the motion. Your chest and head should be up and your shoulder blades retracted. This will be your starting position.

name: Leverage High Row
description: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that you can just reach the handles above you. Adjust the knee pad to help keep you down. Grasp the handles with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position.

name: Leverage Deadlift
description: Load the pins to an appropriate weight. Position yourself directly between the handles. Grasp the bottom handles with a comfortable grip, and then lower your hips as you take a breath. Look forward with your head and keep your chest up. This will be your starting position.

name: Leverage Decline Chest Press
description: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the bottom  of the pectorals at the beginning of the motion. Your chest and head should be up and your shoulder blades retracted. This will be your starting position.

name: Leverage Chest Press
description: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the bottom or middle of the pectorals at the beginning of the motion.

name: Leg-Over Floor Press
description: Lie on the floor with one kettlebell in place on your chest, holding it by the handle. Extend leg on working side over leg on non-working side.Your free arm can be extended out to your side for support.

name: Leg-Up Hamstring Stretch
description: Lie flat on your back, bend one knee, and put that foot flat on the floor to stabilize your spine.

name: Leg Pull-In
description: Lie on an exercise mat with your legs extended and your hands either palms facing down next to you or under your glutes.

name: Leg Press
description: Using a leg press machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a medium (shoulder width) foot stance.  (

name: Leg Lift
description: While standing up straight with both feet next to each other at around shoulder width, grab a sturdy surface such as the sides of a squat rack or the top of a chair to brace yourself and keep balance.

name: Latissimus Dorsi-SMR
description: While lying on the floor, place a foam roll under your back and to one side, just behind your arm pit. This will be your starting position.

name: Leg Extensions
description: For this exercise you will need to use a leg extension machine.  First choose your weight and sit on the machine with your legs under the pad (feet pointed forward) and the hands holding the side bars. This will be your starting position.

name: Lateral Cone Hops
description: Position a number of cones in a row several feet apart.

name: Lateral Raise - With Bands
description: To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length.  Grasp the handles using a pronated (palms facing your thighs) grip that is slightly less than shoulder width.  The handles should be resting on the sides of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight.  This will be your starting position.

name: Lateral Box Jump
description: Assume a comfortable standing position, with a short box positioned next to you. This will be your starting position.

name: Lateral Bound
description: Assume a half squat position facing 90 degrees from your direction of travel. This will be your starting position.

name: Landmine Linear Jammer
description: Position a bar into landmine or, lacking one, securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight and position the handle attachment on the bar.

name: Pyramid
description: Start off by rolling your torso forward onto the ball so your hips rest on top of the ball and become the highest point of your body.

name: Landmine 180's
description: Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight.

name: Push-Ups With Feet On An Exercise Ball
description: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.

name: Pushups (Close and Wide Hand Positions)
description: Lie on the floor face down and body straight with your toes on the floor and the hands wider than shoulder width for a wide hand position and closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure you are holding your torso up at arms length.

name: Pushups
description: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length.

name: Push-Ups - Close Triceps Position
description: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure that you are holding your torso up at arms' length.

name: Push Up to Side Plank
description: Get into pushup position on the toes with your hands just outside of shoulder width.

name: Push-Up Wide
description: With your hands wide apart, support your body on your toes and hands in a plank position. Your elbows should be extended and your body straight. Do not allow your hips to sag. This will be your starting position.

name: Push-Ups With Feet Elevated
description: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.

name: Push Press - Behind the Neck
description: Standing with the weight racked on the back of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible. Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, moving the bar in a vertical path.

name: Pullups
description: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip.  Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width.  For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.

name: Pull Through
description: Begin standing a few feet in front of a low pulley with a rope or handle attached. Face away from the machine, straddling the cable, with your feet set wide apart.

name: Prowler Sprint
description: Place your sled on an appropriate surface, loaded to a suitable weight. The sled should provide enough resistance to require effort, but not so heavy that you are significantly slowed down.

name: Prone Manual Hamstring
description: You will need a partner for this exercise. Lay face down with your legs straight. Your assistant will place their hand on your heel.

name: Preacher Hammer Dumbbell Curl
description: Place the upper part of both arms on top of the preacher bench as you hold a dumbbell in each hand with the palms facing each other (neutral grip).

name: Push Press
description: Beginning Position:

name: Press Sit-Up
description: To begin, lie down on a bench with a barbell resting on your chest.  Position your legs so they are secure on the extension of the abdominal bench.  This is the starting position.

name: Preacher Curl
description: To perform this movement you will need a preacher bench and an E-Z bar.  Grab the E-Z curl bar at the close inner handle (either have someone hand you the bar which is preferable or grab the bar from the front bar rest provided by most preacher benches).  The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar.

name: Power Snatch from Blocks
description: Begin with a loaded barbell on boxes or stands of the desired height. A wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar, with the elbows pointed out. This will be the starting position.

name: Power Stairs
description: In the power stairs, implements are moved up a staircase.  For training purposes, these can be performed with a tire or box.

name: Power Partials
description: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length.  The elbows should be close to the torso.

name: Power Jerk
description: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible.

name: Power Clean from Blocks
description: With a barbell on boxes of the desired height, take a grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back  straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

name: Posterior Tibialis Stretch
description: In a seated position, loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. This will be your starting position.

name: Power Snatch
description: Begin with a loaded barbell on the floor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.

name: Power Clean
description: Note:

name: Plyo Push-up
description: Move into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your hands and toes.

name: Platform Hamstring Slides
description: For this movement a wooden floor or similar is needed. Lay on your back with your legs extended. Place a gym towel or a light weight underneath your heel. This will be your starting position.

name: Plie Dumbbell Squat
description: Hold a dumbbell at the base with both hands and stand straight up.  Move your legs so that they are wider than shoulder width apart from each other with your knees slightly bent.

name: Plyo Kettlebell Pushups
description: Place a kettlebell on the floor. Place yourself in a pushup position, on your toes with one hand on the ground and one hand holding the kettlebell, with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.

name: Plate Pinch
description: Grab two wide-rimmed plates and put them together with the smooth sides facing outward

name: Plank with Twist
description: This is an important abdominal exercise. Get into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.

name: Piriformis-SMR
excerciseType: Foam Roll Piriformis, Myofascial Release Piriformis, Foam Roll Glutes
description: Sit with your buttocks on top of a foam roll. Bend your knees, and then cross one leg so that the ankle is over the knee. This will be your starting position.

name: Pin Presses
description: Pin presses remove the eccentric phase of the bench press, developing starting strength. They also allow you to train a desired range of motion.

name: Plank
description: Get into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.

name: Physioball Hip Bridge
description: Lay on a ball so that your upper back is on the ball with your hips unsupported. Both feet should be flat on the floor, hip width apart or wider. This will be your starting position.

name: Peroneals Stretch
description: In a seated position, loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. This will be your starting position.

name: Peroneals-SMR
excerciseType: Foam Roll Peroneals, Myofascial Release Peroneals
description: Lay on your side, supporting your weight on your forearm and on a foam roller placed on the outside of your lower leg. Your upper leg can either be on top of your lower leg, or you can cross it in front of you. This will be your starting position.

name: Pelvic Tilt Into Bridge
description: Lie down with your feet on the floor, heels directly under your knees.

name: Parallel Bar Dip
description: Stand between a set of parallel bars. Place a hand on each bar, and then take a small jump to help you get into the starting position with your arms locked out.

name: Palms-Up Barbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
description: Start out by placing a barbell on one side of a flat bench.

name: Palms-Up Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
description: Start out by placing two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.

name: Palms-Down Wrist Curl Over A Bench
description: Start out by placing a barbell on one side of a flat bench.

name: Palms-Down Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
description: Start out by placing two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.

name: Pallof Press With Rotation
description: Connect a standard handle to a tower, and position the cable to shoulder height.

name: Overhead Squat
description: Start out by having a barbell in front of you on the floor.  Your feet should be wider than shoulder width apart from each other.

name: Overhead Slam
description: Hold a medine ball with both hands and stand with your feet at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.

name: Overhead Lat
description: Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your tricep and wrist. This will be your starting position.

name: Overhead Cable Curl
description: To begin, set a weight that is comfortable on each side of the pulley machine.

name: Otis-Up
description: Secure your feet and lay back on the floor. Your knees should be bent. Hold a weight with both hands to your chest. This will be your starting position.

name: Open Palm Kettlebell Clean
description: Place one kettlebell between your feet. Clean the kettlebell by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulders.

name: One-Arm Side Laterals
description: Pick a dumbbell and place it in one of your hands.  Your non lifting hand should be used to grab something steady such as an incline bench press.  Lean towards your lifting arm and away from the hand that is gripping the incline bench as this will allow you to keep your balance.

name: One-Arm Side Deadlift
description: Stand to the side of a barbell next to its center. Bend your knees and lower your body until you are able to reach the barbell.

name: One-Legged Cable Kickback
description: Hook a leather ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and then attach the cuff to your ankle.

name: One-Arm Open Palm Kettlebell Clean
description: Place one kettlebell between your feet.

name: One-Arm Overhead Kettlebell Squats
description: Clean and press a kettlebell with one arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so.  Press the weight overhead by extending through the elbow.This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Medicine Ball Slam
description: Start in a standing position with a staggered, athletic stance. Hold a medicine ball in one hand, on the same side as your back leg. This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Long Bar Row
description: Position a bar into a landmine or in a corner to keep it from moving. Load an appropriate weight onto your end.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Swings
description: artofstrength.com

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Split Jerk
description: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Split Snatch
description: Hold a kettlebell  in one hand by the handle.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Snatch
description: Place a kettlebell between your feet. Bend your knees and push your butt back to get in the proper starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Push Press
description: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Para Press
description: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Row
description: Place a kettlebell in front of your feet. Bend your knees slightly and then push your butt out as much as possible as you bend over to get in the starting position. Grab the kettlebell and pull it to your stomach, retracting your shoulder blade and flexing the elbow.  Keep your back straight. Lower and repeat.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Military Press To The Side
excerciseType: Kettlebell Overhead Press, Single-Arm Kettlebell Shoulder Press
description: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces inward. This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Jerk
description: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
description: Lie on the floor holding a kettlebell with one hand, with your upper arm supported by the floor. The palm should be facing in.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Clean
description: Place a kettlebell between your feet. As you bend down to grab the kettlebell, push your butt back and keep your eyes looking forward.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Clean and Jerk
description: Hold a kettlebell by the handle.

name: One-Arm Incline Lateral Raise
description: Lie down sideways on an incline bench press with a dumbbell in the hand.  Make sure the shoulder is pressing against the incline bench and the arm is lying across your body with the palm around your navel.

name: One-Arm High-Pulley Cable Side Bends
description: Connect a standard handle to a tower. Move cable to highest pulley position.

name: One-Arm Flat Bench Dumbbell Flye
description: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand resting on top of your thigh. The palm of your hand with the dumbbell in it should be at a neutral grip.

name: One-Arm Dumbbell Row
excerciseType: Dumbbell Row, Chest-supported Row, Single Arm Row, Single-Arm Row, One Arm Dumbbell Row
description: Choose a flat bench and place a dumbbell on each side of it.

name: One Leg Barbell Squat
excerciseType: Bulgarian Split Squat, Single-Leg Squat, Rear Foot Elevated Split Squat
description: Start by standing about 2 to 3 feet in front of a flat bench with your back facing the bench.  Have a barbell in front of you on the floor.  Tip: Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other.

name: One Knee To Chest
description: Start off by lying on the floor.

name: One Handed Hang
description: Grab onto a chinup bar with one hand, using a pronated grip. Keep your feet on the floor or a step. Allow the majority of your weight to hang from that hand, while keeping your feet on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.

name: One Half Locust
description: Lie facedown on the floor.

name: One Arm Supinated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
excerciseType: One-Arm Triceps Extension, Single-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description: Lie flat on a bench while holding a dumbbell at arms length.  Your arm should be perpendicular to your body.  The palm of your hand should be facing towards your face as a supinated grip is required to perform this exercise.

name: One Arm Lat Pulldown
excerciseType: One-Arm Lat Pulldown, Single Arm Lat Pulldown, Single-Arm Pulldown
description: Select an appropriate weight and adjust the knee pad to help keep you down. Grasp the handle with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position.

name: One Arm Pronated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description: Lie flat on a bench while holding a dumbbell at arms length.  Your arm should be perpendicular to your body.  The palm of your hand should be facing towards your feet as a pronated grip is required to perform this exercise.

name: One Arm Floor Press
excerciseType: One-Arm Floor Press, Single-Arm Floor Press, Floor Press
description: Lie down on a flat surface with your back pressing against the floor or an exercise mat.  Make sure your knees are bent.

name: One Arm Dumbbell Bench Press
excerciseType: One-Arm Dumbbell Press, Single-Arm Dumbbell Press, Single Arm Dumbbell Press, Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand on top of your thigh.

name: One Arm Dumbbell Preacher Curl
excerciseType: One-Arm Preacher Curl, Single Arm Preacher Curl, Single-Arm Preacher Curl
description: Grab a dumbbell with the right arm and place the upper arm on top of the preacher bench or the incline bench.  The dumbbell should be held at shoulder length.  This will be your starting position.

name: One Arm Against Wall
description: From a standing position, place a bent arm against a wall or doorway.

name: One Arm Chin-Up
description: For this exercise, start out by placing a towel around a chin up bar.

name: On Your Side Quad Stretch
description: Start off by lying on your right side, with your right knee bent at a 90-degree angle resting on the floor in front of you (this stabilizes the torso).

name: On-Your-Back Quad Stretch
description: Lie on a flat bench or step, and hang one leg and arm over the side.

name: Olympic Squat
description: Begin with a barbell supported on top of the traps. The chest should be up, and the head facing forward. Adopt a hip width stance with the feet turned out as needed.

name: Oblique Crunches - On The Floor
description: Start out by lying on your right side with your legs lying on top of each other.  Make sure your knees are bent a little bit.

name: Oblique Crunches
description: Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. For this exercise, you will need to put one hand beside your head and the other to the side against the floor.

name: Muscle Snatch
description: Begin with a loaded barbell held at the mid thigh position with a wide grip.  The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.

name: Moving Claw Series
description: This move helps prepare your running form to help you excel at sprinting. As you run, be sure to flex the knee, aiming to kick your glutes as the hip extends.

name: Monster Walk
description: Place a band around both ankles and another around both knees. There should be enough tension that they are tight when your feet are shoulder width apart.

name: Mountain Climbers
description: Begin in a pushup position, with your weight supported by your hands and toes. Flexing the knee and hip, bring one leg until the knee is approximately under the hip. This will be your starting position.

name: Mixed Grip Chin
description: Using a spacing that is just about 1 inch wider than shoulder width, grab a pull-up bar with the palms of one hand facing forward and the palms of the other hand facing towards you.  This will be your starting position.

name: Middle Back Stretch
description: Stand so your feet are shoulder width apart and your hands are on your hips.

name: Medicine Ball Scoop Throw
description: Assume a semisquat stance with a medicine ball in your hands. Your arms should hang so the ball is near your feet.

name: Medicine Ball Full Twist
description: For this exercise you will need a medicine ball and a partner. Stand back to back with your partner, spaced 2-3 feet apart. This will be your starting position.

name: Medicine Ball Chest Pass
description: You will need a partner for this exercise. Lacking one, this movement can be performed against a wall.

name: Middle Back Shrug
description: Lie facedown on an incline bench while holding a dumbbell in each hand.  Your arms should be fully extended hanging down and pointing towards the floor.  The palms of your hands should be facing each other.  This will be your starting position.

name: Machine Triceps Extension
description: Adjust the seat to the appropriate height and make your weight selection. Place your upper arms against the pads and grasp the handles. This will be your starting position.

name: Machine Shoulder (Military) Press
description: Sit down on the Shoulder Press Machine and select the weight.

name: Machine Bicep Curl
description: Adjust the seat to the appropriate height and make your weight selection. Place your upper arms against the pads and grasp the handles. This will be your starting position.

name: Machine Preacher Curls
description: Sit down on the Preacher Curl Machine and select the weight.

name: Machine Bench Press
description: Sit down on the Chest Press Machine and select the weight.

name: Narrow Stance Squats
description: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes.  To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height.  Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.

name: Natural Glute Ham Raise
description: Using the leg pad of a lat pulldown machine or a preacher bench, position yourself so that your ankles are under the pads, knees on the seat, and you are facing away from the machine. You should be upright and maintaining good posture.

name: Narrow Stance Leg Press
description: Using a leg press machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a less-than-shoulder-width narrow stance with the toes slightly pointed out.  Your feet should be around 3 inches or less apart.

name: Narrow Stance Hack Squats
description: Place the back of your torso against the back pad of the machine and hook your shoulders under the shoulder pads provided.

name: Kneeling Single-Arm High Pulley Row
description: Attach a single handle to a high pulley and make your weight selection.

name: Kneeling Hip Flexor
description: Kneel on a mat and bring your right knee up so the bottom of your foot is on the floor and extend your left leg out behind you so the top of your foot is on the floor.

name: Kneeling Jump Squat
description: Begin kneeling on the floor with a barbell racked across the back of your shoulders, or you can use your body weight for this exercise. This can be done inside of a power rack to make unracking easier.

name: Kneeling Forearm Stretch
description: Start by kneeling on a mat with your palms flat and your fingers pointing back toward your knees.

name: Kneeling High Pulley Row
description: Select the appropriate weight using a pulley that is above your head. Attach a rope to the cable and kneel a couple of feet away, holding the rope out in front of you with both arms extended. This will be your starting position.

name: Neck Press
excerciseType: Clavicular Bench Press, Elbows-out Barbell Press, Guillotine Press
description: Lie back on a flat bench.  Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked.  This will be your starting position.

name: Kneeling Cable Triceps Extension
description: Place a bench sideways in front of a high pulley machine.

name: Kneeling Cable Crunch With Alternating Oblique Twists
description: Connect a rope attachment to a high pulley cable and position a mat on the floor in front of it.

name: Kneeling Arm Drill
description: This drill helps increase arm efficiency during the run. Begin kneeling, left foot in front, right knee down. Apply pressure through the front heel to keep your glutes and hamstrings activated.

name: Knee-Hip Raise On Parallel Bars
excerciseType: Knee / Hip Raise On Parallel Bars
description: Position your body on the vertical leg raise bench so that your forearms are resting on the pads next to the torso and holding on to the handles.  Your arms will be bent at a 90 degree angle.

name: Knee Circles
description: Stand with your legs together and hands by your waist.

name: Knee Tuck Jump
description: Begin in a comfortable standing position with your knees slightly bent. Hold your hands in front of you, palms down with your fingertips together at chest height. This will be your starting position.

name: Kipping Muscle Up
description: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings.

name: Knee Across The Body
description: Lie down on the floor with your right leg straight. Bend your left leg and lower it across your body, holding the knee down toward the floor with your right hand. (The knee doesn't need to touch the floor if you're tight.)

name: Kettlebell Windmill
description: Place a kettlebell in front of your lead foot and clean and press it overhead with your opposite arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. Press it overhead by extending the elbow.

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-Up (Squat style)
description: Lie on your back on the  floor and press a kettlebell to the top position by extending the elbow. Bend the knee on the same side as the kettlebell.

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-Up (Lunge style)
description: Lie on your back on the  floor and press a kettlebell to the top position by extending the elbow. Bend the knee on the same side as the kettlebell.

name: Kettlebell Thruster
description: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so. This will be your starting position.

name: Kettlebell Seated Press
description: Sit on the floor and spread your legs out comfortably.

name: Kettlebell Sumo High Pull
description: Place a kettlebell on the ground between your feet. Position your feet in a wide stance, and grasp the kettlebell with two hands. Set your hips back as far as possible, with your knees  bent. Keep your chest and head up. This will be your starting position.

name: Kettlebell Seesaw Press
description: Clean two kettlebells two your shoulders.

name: Kettlebell Pistol Squat
description: Pick up a kettlebell with two hands and hold it by the horns. Hold one leg off of the floor and squat down on the other.

name: Kettlebell Pass Between The Legs
description: Place one kettlebell between your legs and take a comfortable stance. Bend over by pushing your butt out and keeping your back flat.

name: Kettlebell Pirate Ships
description: With a wide stance, hold a kettlebell with both hands. Allow it to hang at waist level with your arms extended. This will be your starting position.

name: Kettlebell One-Legged Deadlift
description: Hold a kettlebell by the handle in one hand. Stand on one leg, on the same side that you hold the kettlebell.

name: Kettlebell Hang Clean
description: Place kettlebell between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.

name: Kettlebell Dead Clean
description: Place kettlebell between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.

name: Kettlebell Arnold Press
description: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulder. The palm should be facing inward.

name: Keg Load
description: To load kegs, place the desired number a distance from the loading platform, typically 30-50 feet.

name: Kettlebell Figure 8
description: Place one kettlebell between your legs and take a wider than shoulder width stance. Bend over by pushing your butt out and keeping your back flat.

name: Isometric Neck Exercise - Front And Back
description: With your head and neck in a neutral position (normal position with head erect facing forward), place both of your hands on the front side of your head.

name: Isometric Neck Exercise - Sides
description: With your head and neck in a neutral position (normal position with head erect facing forward), place your left hand on the left side of your head.

name: Isometric Wipers
description: Assume a push-up position, supporting your weight on your hands and toes while keeping your body straight. Your hands should be just outside of shoulder width. This will be your starting position.

name: Inverted Row with Straps
description: Hang a rope or suspension straps from a rack or other stable object. Grasp the ends and position yourself in a supine position hanging from the ropes. Your body should be straight with your heels on the ground with your arms fully extended. This will be your starting position.

name: Iron Crosses (stretch)
description: Lie face down on the floor, with your arms extended out to your side, palms pressed to the floor. This will be your starting position.

name: Isometric Chest Squeezes
description: While either seating or standing, bend your arms at a 90-degree angle and place the palms of your hands together in front of your chest.

name: Iron Cross
description: 1. Stand with feet shoulder width apart holding a dumbbell in each hand.

name: Inverted Row
description: Position a bar in a rack to about waist height. You can also use a smith machine.

name: Intermediate Groin Stretch
description: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Loop a belt, rope, or band around one of your feet, and swing that leg as far to the side as you can. This will be your starting position.

name: Internal Rotation with Band
description: Choke the band around a post. The band should be at the same height as your elbow. Stand with your right side to the band a couple of feet away.

name: Intermediate Hip Flexor and Quad Stretch
description: Lie face down on the floor, with a rope, belt, or band looped around one foot.

name: Incline Push-Up Wide
description: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an appropriate height.

name: Incline Push-Up Reverse Grip
description: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an appropriate height.

name: Incline Push-Up Medium
description: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an appropriate height.

name: Incline Push-Up Close-Grip
description: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an appropriate height.

name: Incline Push-Up Depth Jump
description: For this drill you will need a box about 12 inches high, and two thick mats or aerobics steps.

name: Incline Inner Biceps Curl
description: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie back on an incline bench.

name: Incline Hammer Curls
description: Seat yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. You should pressed firmly against he back with your feet together. Allow the dumbbells to hang straight down at your side, holding them with a neutral grip. This will be your starting position.

name: Incline Push-Up
description: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
description: Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand atop your thighs. The palms of your hands will be facing each other.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes - With A Twist
description: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie on an incline bench that is set to an incline angle of no more than 30 degrees.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes
description: Hold a dumbbell on each hand and lie on an incline bench that is set to an incline angle of no more than 30 degrees.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench With Palms Facing In
description: Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.

name: Incline Cable Chest Press
description: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.

name: Incline Cable Flye
description: To get yourself into the starting position, set the pulleys at the floor level (lowest level possible on the machine that is below your torso).

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
description: Sit back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length.  Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.  This will be your starting position.

name: Incline Barbell Triceps Extension
description: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip (palms down) that is a little closer together than shoulder width.

name: Iliotibial Tract-SMR
excerciseType: Myofascial Release IT Band, Foam Roll Iliotibial Band
description: Lay on your side, with the bottom leg placed onto a foam roller between the hip and the knee. The other leg can be crossed in front of you.

name: Incline Bench Pull
description: Grab a dumbbell in each hand and lie face down on an incline bench that is set to an incline that is approximately 30 degrees.

name: Jerk Dip Squat
description: This movement strengthens the dip portion of the jerk. Begin with the bar racked in the jerk position, with the shoulders forward to create a shelf and the bar lightly contacting the throat. The feet should be directly under the hips, with the feet turned out as is comfortable.

name: JM Press
description: Start the exercise the same way you would a close grip bench press.  You will lie on a flat bench while holding a barbell at arms length (fully extended) with the elbows in.  However, instead of having the arms perpendicular to the torso, make sure the bar is set in a direct line above the upper chest.  This will be your starting position.

name: Jerk Balance
description: This drill helps you learn to drive yourself low enough during the jerk and corrects those who move backward during the movement. Begin with the bar racked in the jerk position, with the shoulders forward, torso upright, and the feet split slightly apart.

name: Janda Sit-Up
description: Note:

name: Jefferson Squats
description: Place a barbell on the floor.

name: Front Two-Dumbbell Raise
description: Pick a couple of dumbbells and stand with a straight torso and the dumbbells on front of your thighs at arms length with the palms of the hand facing your thighs.  This will be your starting position.

name: Jackknife Sit-Up
description: Lie flat on the floor (or exercise mat) on your back with your arms extended straight back behind your head and your legs extended also. This will be your starting position.

name: Front Squat (Clean Grip)
description: To begin, first set the bar in a rack slightly below shoulder level.  Rest the bar on top of the deltoids, pushing into the clavicles,  and lightly touching the throat. Your hands should be in a clean grip, touching the bar only with your fingers to help keep it in position.

name: Front Squats With Two Kettlebells
description: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.

name: Front Raise And Pullover
description: Lie on a flat bench while holding a barbell using a palms down grip that is about 15 inches apart.

name: Front Leg Raises
description: Stand next to a chair or other support, holding on with one hand.

name: Front Plate Raise
description: While standing straight, hold a barbell plate in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended and locked with a slight bend at the elbows and the plate should be down near your waist in front of you as far as you can go.

name: Front Dumbbell Raise
description: Pick a couple of dumbbells and stand with a straight torso and the dumbbells on front of your thighs at arms length with the palms of the hand facing your thighs.  This will be your starting position.

name: Front Cone Hops (or hurdle hops)
description: Set up a row of cones or other small barriers, placing them a few feet apart.

name: Front Incline Dumbbell Raise
description: Sit down on an incline bench with the incline set anywhere between 30 to 60 degrees while holding a dumbbell on each hand. Tip: You can change the angle to hit the muscle a little differently each time.

name: Front Cable Raise
description: Select the weight on a low pulley machine and grasp the single hand cable attachment that is attached to the low pulley with your left hand.

name: Front Box Jump
description: Begin with a box of an appropriate height 1-2 feet in front of you. Stand with your feet should width apart. This will be your starting position.

name: Front Barbell Squat To A Bench
description: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes.  To begin, first set a flat bench behind you and set the bar on a rack that best matches your height.  Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, bring your arms up under the bar while keeping the elbows high and the upper arm slightly above parallel to the floor.  Rest the bar on top of the deltoids and cross your arms while grasping the bar for total control.

name: Front Barbell Squat
description: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes.  To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height.  Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, bring your arms up under the bar while keeping the elbows high and the upper arm slightly above parallel to the floor.  Rest the bar on top of the deltoids and cross your arms while grasping the bar for total control.

name: Frog Hops
description: Stand with your hands behind your head, and squat down keeping your torso upright and your head up. This will be your starting position.

name: Frankenstein Squat
description: This drill teaches you the proper positioning of both the bar and your body during the clean and front squat.

name: Forward Drag with Press
description: Attach a dual handled chain or rope attachment to the sled. You should be facing away from the sled, holding a handle in each hand.

name: Frog Sit-Ups
description: Lie with your back flat on the floor (or exercise mat) and your legs extended in front of you.

name: Foot-SMR
description: This exercise stretches the fascia of the muscles in the feet. Start off seated with your shoes removed. Using a foot roller or a similar object, such as a small section of pvc pipe, place your foot against the roller across the arch of your foot. This will be your starting position.

name: Floor Press with Chains
description: Adjust the j-hooks so they are at the appropriate height to rack the bar. For this exercise, drape the chains directly over the end of the bar, trying to keep the ends away from the plates.

name: Flutter Kicks
description: On a flat bench lie facedown with the hips on the edge of the bench, the legs straight with toes high off the floor and with the arms on top of the bench holding on to the front edge.

name: Floor Press
description: Adjust the j-hooks so they are at the appropriate height to rack the bar. Begin lying on the floor with your head near the end of a power rack. Keeping your shoulder blades pulled together; pull the bar off of the hooks.

name: Freehand Jump Squat
description: Cross your arms over your chest.

name: Floor Glute-Ham Raise
description: You can use a partner for this exercise or brace your feet under something stable.

name: Flexor Incline Dumbbell Curls
description: Hold the dumbbell towards the side farther from you so that you have more weight on the side closest to you. (This can be done for a good effect on all bicep dumbbell exercises). Now do a normal incline dumbbell curl, but keep your wrists as far back as possible so as to neutralize any stress that is placed on them.

name: Flat Bench Leg Pull-In
description: Lie on an exercise mat or a flat bench with your legs off the end.

name: Flat Bench Lying Leg Raise
description: Lie with your back flat on a bench and your legs extended in front of you off the end.

name: Finger Curls
description: Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.

name: Fast Skipping
description: Start in a relaxed position with one leg slightly forward. This will be your starting position.

name: Flat Bench Cable Flyes
description: Position a flat bench between two low pulleys so that when you are laying on it, your chest will be lined up with the cable pulleys.

name: Face Pull
description: Facing a high pulley with a rope or dual handles attached, pull the weight directly towards your face, separating your hands as you do so. Keep your upper arms parallel to the ground.

name: Dynamic Back Stretch
description: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.

name: Farmer's Walk
description: There are various implements that can be used for the farmers walk. These can also be performed with heavy dumbbells or short bars if these implements aren't available. Begin by standing between the implements.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Extension -Pronated Grip
description: Lie down on a flat bench holding two dumbbells directly above your shoulders.  Your arms should be fully extended and form a 90 degree angle from your torso and the floor.

name: Dumbbell Step Ups
description: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

name: Dumbbell Squat
description: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
description: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on the left hand (palms facing the torso) as you have the right hand holding your waist.  Your feet should be placed at shoulder width.  This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Squat To A Bench
description: Stand up straight with a flat bench behind you while holding a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

name: Dumbbell Shrug
description: Stand erect with a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing your torso), arms extended on the sides.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: While holding a dumbbell in each hand, sit on a military press bench or utility bench that has back support.  Place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs.

name: Dumbbell Seated Box Jump
description: Position a box a couple feet to the side of a bench. Hold a dumbbell to your chest with both hands and seat yourself on the bench facing the box. This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Seated One-Leg Calf Raise
description: Place a block on the floor about 12 inches from a flat bench.

name: Dumbbell Scaption
description: This corrective exercise strengthens the muscles that stabilize your shoulder blade. Hold a light weight in each hand, hanging at your sides. Your thumbs should pointing up.

name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
description: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides.  This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Upright Row
description: Grab a dumbbell and stand up straight with your arm extended in front of you with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight.  This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Raise
description: Grab a dumbbell in each arm and stand up straight with your arms extended by your sides with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight.  This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Triceps Extension
description: Grab a dumbbell and either sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.

name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise
excerciseType: Reverse Dumbbell Fly, Rear Delt Raise
description: While holding a dumbbell in each hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Shoulder Press
description: Grab a dumbbell and either sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.

name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
description: Grab a dumbbell on each hand and lie face down on an incline bench with your shoulders near top of the incline. Your knees can rest on the seat or your legs can be straddled to the sides (my preferred way).

name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
description: Lie sideways on a flat bench with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.

name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation
description: Lie on a flat bench face down with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.

name: Dumbbell Lying One-Arm Rear Lateral Raise
excerciseType: Dumbbell Reverse Fly, Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise
description: While holding a dumbbell in one hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench.  The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.

name: Dumbbell Lunges
description: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides.  This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
description: Lay on the floor holding dumbbells in your hands. Your knees can be bent. Begin with the weights fully extended above you.

name: Dumbbell Incline Row
description: Using a neutral grip, lean into an incline bench.

name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raise
description: Sit on an Incline Bench while holding a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs.

name: Dumbbell Clean
description: Begin standing with a dumbbell in each hand with your feet shoulder width apart.

name: Dumbbell Flyes
description: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell on each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press with Neutral Grip
description: Take a dumbbell in each hand and lay back onto a flat bench. Your feet should be flat on the floor and your shoulder blades retracted.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
description: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length.  Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Alternate Bicep Curl
description: Stand (torso upright) with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length.  The elbows should be close to the torso and the palms of your hand should be facing your thighs.

name: Downward Facing Balance
description: Lie facedown on top of an exercise ball.

name: Drag Curl
description: Grab a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing forward) and get your elbows close to your torso and back. This will be your starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hands will be facing each other.

name: Double Leg Butt Kick
description: Begin standing with your knees slightly bent.

name: Drop Push
description: Position low boxes or other platforms 2-3 feet apart.

name: Double Kettlebell Windmill
description: Place a kettlebell in front of your front foot and clean and press a kettlebell overhead with your opposite arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.

name: Double Kettlebell Snatch
description: Place two kettlebells behind your feet. Bend your knees and sit back to pick up the kettlebells.

name: Double Kettlebell Push Press
description: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders.

name: Double Kettlebell Jerk
description: Hold a kettlebell by the handle in each hand.

name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Hang Clean
description: Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.

name: Dips - Chest Version
description: For this exercise you will need access to parallel bars.  To get yourself into the starting position, hold your body at arms length (arms locked) above the bars.

name: Dips - Triceps Version
description: To get into the starting position, hold your body at arm's length with your arms nearly locked above the bars.

name: Donkey Calf Raises
description: For this exercise you will need access to a donkey calf raise machine.  Start by positioning your lower back and hips under the padded lever provided.  The tailbone area should be the one making contact with the pad.

name: Dip Machine
description: Sit securely in a dip machine, select the weight and firmly grasp the handles.

name: Depth Jump Leap
description: For this drill you will need two boxes or benches, one 12 to 16 inches high and the other 22 to 26 inches high.

name: Decline Smith Press
description: Place a decline bench underneath the Smith machine. Now place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms extended. This will be your starting position.

name: Deficit Deadlift
description: Begin by having a platform or weight plates that you can stand on, usually 1-3 inches in height. Approach the bar so that it is centered over your feet. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, allowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typically, you would use an overhand grip or an over/under grip on heavier sets.

name: Decline Oblique Crunch
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

name: Decline EZ Bar Triceps Extension
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

name: Decline Push-Up
description: Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length. Move your feet up to a box or bench. This will be your starting position.

name: Decline Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.

name: Decline Reverse Crunch
description: Lie on your back on a decline bench and hold on to the top of the bench with both hands. Don't let your body slip down from this position.

name: Decline Dumbbell Flyes
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.

name: Decline Crunch
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down.

name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.

name: Decline Close-Grip Bench To Skull Crusher
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

name: Deadlift with Bands
description: To deadlift with short bands, simply loop them over the bar before you start, and step into them to set up. For long bands, they will need to be anchored to a secure base, such as heavy dumbbells or a rack.

name: Deadlift with Chains
description: You can attach the chains to the sleeves of the bar, or just drape the middle over the bar so there is a greater weight increase as you lift.

name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
description: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

name: Butt-Ups
description: Begin a pushup position but with your elbows on the ground and resting on your forearms. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle.

name: Butterfly
description: Sit on the machine with your back flat on the pad.

name: Dead Bug
description: Begin lying on your back with your hands extended above you toward the ceiling.

name: Bradford-Rocky Presses
excerciseType: Bradford Press, Rocky Press, Alternating Shoulder Press, Seated Barbell Press
description: Sit on a Military Press Bench with a bar at shoulder level with a pronated grip (palms facing forward).

name: Box Squat with Chains
description: Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

name: Box Squat with Bands
description: Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you.  Set up the bands on the sleeves, secured to either band pegs, the rack, or dumbbells so that there is appropriate tension. If dumbbells are used, secure them so that they don't move. Also, ensure that the dumbbells you are using are heavy enough for the bands that you are using. Additional plates can be used to hold the dumbbells down.  If more tension is needed, you can either widen the base on the floor or choke the bands. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

name: Box Skip
description: You will need several boxes lined up about 8 feet apart.

name: Box Squat
description: The box squat allows you to squat to desired depth and develop explosive strength in the squat movement. Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

name: Box Jump (Multiple Response)
description: Assume a relaxed stance facing the box or platform approximately an arm's length away. Arms should be down at the sides and legs slightly bent.

name: Bottoms-Up Clean From The Hang Position
description: Initiate the exercise by standing upright with a kettlebell in one hand.

name: Bottoms Up
description: Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms at your side. This will be your starting position.

name: Brachialis-SMR
description: Lie on your side, with your upper arm against the foam roller. The upper arm should be more or less aligned with your body, with the outside of the bicep pressed against the foam roller.

name: Bosu Ball Cable Crunch With Side Bends
description: Connect a standard handle to each arm of a cable machine, and position them in the most downward position.

name: Bodyweight Walking Lunge
description: Begin standing with your feet shoulder width apart and your hands on your hips.

name: Butt Lift (Bridge)
description: Lie flat on the floor on your back with the hands by your side and your knees bent.   Your feet should be placed around shoulder width.  This will be your starting position.

name: Bodyweight Squat
description: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. You can place your hands behind your head. This will be your starting position.

name: Bodyweight Mid Row
description: Begin by taking a medium to wide grip on a pull-up apparatus with your palms facing away from you. From a hanging position, tuck your knees to your chest, leaning back and getting your legs over your side of the pull-up apparatus. This will be your starting position.

name: Body-Up
description: Assume a plank position on the ground. You should be supporting your bodyweight on your toes and forearms, keeping your torso straight. Your forearms should be shoulder-width apart. This will be your starting position.

name: Bodyweight Flyes
description: Position two equally loaded EZ bars on the ground next to each other. Ensure they are able to roll.

name: Board Press
description: Begin by lying on the bench, getting your head beyond the bar if possible. One to five boards, made out of 2x6's, can be screwed together and held in place by a training partner, bands, or just tucked under your shirt.

name: Body Tricep Press
description: Position a bar in a rack at chest height.

name: Bicycling, Stationary
description: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

name: Bicycling
description: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

name: Bent-Knee Hip Raise
description: Lay flat on the floor with your arms next to your sides.

name: Bent-Arm Dumbbell Pullover
description: Place a dumbbell standing up on a flat bench.

name: Bent Press
description: Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder.  Clean the kettlebell to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so. This will be your starting position.

name: Bent-Arm Barbell Pullover
description: Lie on a flat bench with a barbell using a shoulder grip width.

name: Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row With Palms In
excerciseType: bent-over row, neutral grip dumbbell row
description: With a dumbbell in each hand (palms facing each other), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor.  Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up.  The weights should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso.  This is your starting position.

name: Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row
excerciseType: dumbbell row, bent-over dumbbell row, bent over row
description: With a dumbbell in each hand (palms facing your torso), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward by bending at the waist; as you bend make sure to keep your back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor.

name: Bent Over Two-Arm Long Bar Row
description: Put weight on one of the ends of an Olympic barbell. Make sure that you either place the other end of the barbell in the corner of two walls; or put a heavy object  on the ground so the barbell cannot slide backward.

name: Bench Sprint
description: Stand on the ground with one foot resting on a bench or box with your heel close to the edge.

name: Bent Over One-Arm Long Bar Row
excerciseType: Bent-Over One Arm T-Bar Row, Single-Arm Row, Single Arm Row
description: Put weight on one of the ends of an Olympic barbell. Make sure that you either place the other end of the barbell in the corner of two walls; or put a heavy object on the ground so the barbell cannot slide backward.

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise With Head On Bench
excerciseType: Bent-Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise With Head On Bench
description: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand and with an incline bench in front of you.

name: Bent Over Barbell Row
excerciseType: Bent-Over Row, Bent Over Row, Barbell Row
description: Holding a barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing down), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor.  Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up.  The barbell should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso.  This is your starting position.

name: Bent Over Low-Pulley Side Lateral
excerciseType: rear delt cable raise, rear delt raise
description: Select a weight and hold the handle of the low pulley with your right hand.

name: Bench Press with Chains
description: Adjust the leader chain, shortening it to the desired length.Place the chains on the sleeves of the bar.

name: Bench Press - With Bands
description: Using a flat bench secure a band under the leg of the bench that is nearest to your head.

name: Bench Press - Powerlifting
description: Begin by lying on the bench, getting your head beyond the bar if possible. Tuck your feet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help support your weight, lift your shoulder off the bench and retract them, squeezing the shoulder blades together. Use your feet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.

name: Bench Jump
excerciseType: Front Jump, Front Bench Jump, Front Box Jump
description: Begin with a box or bench 1-2 feet in front of you. Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.

name: Battling Ropes
description: For this exercise you will need a heavy rope anchored at its center 15-20 feet away. Standing in front of the rope, take an end in each hand with your arms extended at your side. This will be your starting position.

name: Behind Head Chest Stretch
description: Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you.

name: Bear Crawl Sled Drags
description: Wearing either a harness or a loose weight belt, attach the chain to the back so that you will be facing away from the sled. Bend down so that your hands are on the ground. Your back should be flat and knees bent. This is your starting position.

name: Bench Dips
description: For this exercise you will need to place a bench behind your back.  With the bench perpendicular to your body, and while looking away from it, hold on to the bench on its edge with the hands fully extended, separated at shoulder width. The legs will be extended forward, bent at the waist and perpendicular to your torso.  This will be your starting position.

name: Barbell Walking Lunge
description: Begin standing with your feet shoulder width apart and a barbell across your upper back.

name: Barbell Step Ups
description: Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) and stand upright behind an elevated platform (such as the one used for spotting behind a flat bench). This is your starting position.

name: Barbell Squat To A Bench
description: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes.  To begin, first place a flat bench or a box behind you.  The flat bench is used to teach you to set your hips back and to hit depth.

name: Barbell Side Split Squat
description: Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck).  Your feet should be placed wide apart with the foot of the lead leg angled out to the side. This will be your starting position.

name: Barbell Squat
description: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes.  To begin, first set the bar on a rack to just below shoulder level.  Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.

name: Barbell Shrug Behind The Back
